meanings.definition: relating to or denoting any disease or condition that arises spontaneously or for which the cause is unknown
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed her with an idiopathic condition that puzzled everyone.
meanings.sent2: The medical team was baffled by the idiopathic nature of the illness.
meanings.sent3: It was quite idiopathic how his sneezing fits only happened on sunny days.
meanings.sent4: The sudden disappearance of the keys remained an idiopathic mystery.
meanings.sent5: The idiopathic rash spread rapidly, causing concern among the staff.

meanings.sent1: The idiopathic fever left the doctors scratching their heads.
meanings.sent2: The idiopathic disappearance of the cat left the family worried.
meanings.sent3: It was idiopathic how the flowers bloomed in the middle of winter.
meanings.sent4: The idiopathic power outage plunged the neighborhood into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The idiopathic laughter from the empty room sent shivers down their spines.
